job_title: ARt Associate in Saint Paul, MN
pros: You will gain experience in a college setting teaching and maintaining art studios. The schedule is flexible and benefits are good.
cons: Religious views of students and some staff/faculty can make the work environment claustrophobic and disempowering. The pay isn’t great either.

pros: Great community of ppl, team atmosphere

review_title: Great Environment, Low Appreciation of Employees
pros: Environment. Helping students reach their goals. Christ-centered and family-friendly environment. Fairly strong benefits package.
cons: Low pay. Lack of appreciation and support from administration. Tough to communication with administration; My experience has been that they rarely get back to you with legitimate concerns.

review_title: It was a great working environment in the Admissions department
pros: The christian atmosphere and community is excellent! Also it feels like a family and a place where your talents can grow.
cons: The schedule for an Admission Counselor is very hectic. During recruiting season, you can expect to be on the road for weeks at a time, but you do get a car and a credit card to help with expenses.

job_title: Associate Faculty in South Bend, IN
pros: A warm and inviting professional environment with a lot of personal attention paid to the students. Classes are smaller than at the public university nearby. It is an openly conservative Christian school, which is important to keep in mind when you apply for a job.
cons: Adjuncts don't teach for the money, but actually they don't pay too badly. I enjoy working there.
